subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: boxes on ebay (He charges people to do box sessions)
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
--297796611-1304756732-1207601560=:2575
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=iso-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8BIT


I was bidding on a 5X7 negative carrier for my fairly newly acquired Omega 
E5 5X7 enlarger (I got it minus a few parts).  Someone finally won the 
auction for $153.  You can get a new one for $105.

Another one came along a month later and I won it for $23.

So it goes.

Zack

On Mon, 7 Apr 2008, itcdeadpeople wrote:

> OMG, Kay.  Well, you know the old saying...
>
> A fool and his/her money are soon parted.
>
> That's too bad.  And now that eBay has disabled privately contacting bidders (which I used
> to do) there is no way of saving them from themselves.  If this is the same unit I saw
> before, it isn't even one of the old 12-469's, but the new version they could easily get
> elsewhere.
>
> Hey, I just had this thought.  It would cost a small amount of money for the listing, but
> someone could list a FREE DOWNLOAD of the instructions on how to hack the radio shack
> units for themselves.  That could put people like this seller out of business.
>
> Just a thought!
>
> Margaret
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psfponies" <psfponies@...> wrote:
>>
>> The current bid on the hacked RS 12-469 on ebay is $100.00.
>>
>> Kay
>>
>>
>> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@>
>> wrote:
>>>
>>> That's a whole lot of IF's, Michael, but IF all those things were
>> to come together, it
>>> certainly would be a quandary as to whether or not approaching a
>> complete stranger
>>> would be appropriate.  One can argue that the person in spirit has
>> gone to great lengths
>>> to make contact with their loved one.  However.......
>>>
>>> On the flip side, just because someone is in spirit, does not mean
>> that they are
>>> automatically omniscient, nor that they have the right to impose
>> their will (or you impose
>>> your will, for that matter) on a loved one who may not be open to
>> the communication
>>> emotionally or spiritually.
>>>
>>> Assuming we are (as many indications have it) pretty much the same
>> person in spirit that
>>> we were here in the physical (our personalities remain fairly in
>> tact, though just as here,
>>> there can be growth and change on the other side), it would not be
>> out of the realm of
>>> possibility for them to tell you their loved one is open to
>> communication, when in fact they
>>> might not be.
>>>
>>> I guess my bottom line is this:  There are so many people out
>> there who are open to the
>>> idea of EVP communication and are seeking to make contact with
>> their departed loved
>>> ones, that there is no need for approaching strangers with
>> messages.  The potential for
>>> harm is just too great, and it is not our place (or the place of
>> the person in spirit) to make
>>> these kind of decisions for others.  If this is what interests you
>> (helping those in spirit to
>>> pass messages along), then seek to make connections with people in
>> the physical who are
>>> openly and willingly on board your assistance.
>>>
>>> Margaret
>>>
>>>>>> Margaret and other colleagues on this forum, if a proven
>> process can be initiated, the
>>> information captured very clearly, and not faint, and it has to be
>> clear that anyone
>>> listening will hear the words, and if the spirit can confirm the
>> info we have before them to
>>> be accurate, and if the spirit can assure us that their loved one
>> will not be offended, then
>>> would it be ok for us to proceed? And why not? <<<
>>>
>>> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Michael Edwards <f1cracker75@>
>> wrote:
>>>>
>>>> Thanks Margaret.
>>>>
>>>>   If your vocation is a psychic in which patrons pay a known fee
>> up front, and this
>>> physcic uses the box as an additional tool to get that icing on
>> the cake, the actual voice,
>>> that I have no issues with. In every field there are crooks, so we
>> can at best hope we are
>>> with a kind person when the meeting takes place.
>>>>
>>>>   But if a person just goes out and buys a radio shack hack, and
>> this is not their field,
>>> and they do get a message, if these individuals try and make money
>> off the recipient of
>>> the message, that would in my book be terrible. The reason is that
>> the spirit contacted
>>> the living to get help, and now that living person is ripping off
>> their loved one for cash
>>> before they deliver the goods. If a spirit asks for help, we
>> should do it for free.
>>>>
>>>>   I write procedures for my company, and have been outlining a
>> process to test with a
>>> willing spirit who wants to make contact  with their loved one.
>>>>
>>>>   So what would I or any of us need to make contact? Meaning if
>> a spirit gave me "John
>>> Smith" of Norfolk, VA, confirmation would be a night mare at best.
>> I would need to
>>> perhaps lay out a list of actuall addresses in that city and state
>> to have the spirit tell me
>>> which one on my desk, on my list is the correct oerson, and then
>> as you say how would
>>> this person respond to my call about my research and that a voice
>> gave me their name and
>>> I have a recorded message for them?
>>>>
>>>>   Margaret and other colleagues on this forum, if a proven
>> process can be initiated, the
>>> information captured very clearly, and not faint, and it has to be
>> clear that anyone
>>> listening will hear the words, and if the spirit can confirm the
>> info we have before them to
>>> be accurate, and if the spirit can assure us that their loved one
>> will not be offended, then
>>> would it be ok for us to proceed? And why not?
>>>>
>>>>   My plan is to set up a spirit profile along with on same page
>> the loved one's profile. But
>>> before I actually make contact, I want to be sure that who i am
>> contacting is the real deal,
>>> and that they will not be offended. I have been laying out canned
>> calls, for example,
>>> "Hello, my name is xyz, and I am engaged in xxx research involving
>> EVP. (Explain what
>>> that is), and a voice picked up on my recording gave me your name,
>> and go from there.
>>>>
>>>>   Thinking out loud here, I would think that the sprit would
>> know if their loved one
>>> would be in acceptance to me contacting them.
>>>>
>>>>   I am documenting everything step by step, and I do plan to
>> attempt contact if I have
>>> the right info. I am thinking that I need to tweak my profile to
>> get confirmation on
>>> whether the loved one would be in acceptance of me delivering the
>> message.
>>>>
>>>>   If there are any of you that have actually contacted a loved
>> one you did not know that a
>>> spirit asked you to contact, please advise how you handled the
>> first call.
>>>>
>>>>   I know it may take me days, weeks, months and even perhaps
>> years to get enough info
>>> on one profile to make contact, but I really want to do this and I
>> want to perfect it, so
>>> others can become messengers for the deceased.
>>>>
>>>> itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople@> wrote:
>>>>           Hi Michael. I have had the honor many times of either
>> receiving messages for
>>> someone
>>>> from their loved one and passing them on (to people I know) or
>> in helping people learn
>>> to
>>>> record for and receive their own messages. Along with research
>> in trying to improve
>>>> communication with the other side, this is my primary work with
>> EVP... helping others
>>> who
>>>> are grieving make contact with their loved ones. I do not charge
>> for this.
>>>>
>>>> I think to charge, or attempt to charge, anyone for a service
>> (spiritual or otherwise) on
>>> the
>>>> backend is slimy. However, if there is an agreement in advance
>> about fees and services,
>>>> then that is up to the consenting parties. People in all types
>> of fields get paid for their
>>>> time, regardless of the service being offered. If the fee is
>> clear, the service being offered
>>>> legitimate, so be it. As long as people aren't being scammed.
>> grrrr...... I don't like to see
>>>> people taken advantage of in any field of service (as one
>> crooked auto mechanic tried to
>>>> do recently with my mother.) Double grrrrrr........
>>>>
>>>> As for figuring out who a message belongs to? I think we have to
>> be very cautious in
>>>> coming forward with content in recordings that were not
>> requested by the living loved
>>> one
>>>> of the person in spirit. It's sort of like the doctor's creed to
>> first do no harm. I feel unless
>>>> you know someone well enough to be fairly certain that your
>> doing so would not
>>>> traumatize them, you have to err on the side of caution and not
>> say anything.
>>>>
>>>> For instance, there are some people who, due to their religious
>> beliefs, could feel that
>>> you
>>>> are being fooled by a demon or some other evil and that your
>> saying you are in a touch
>>>> with a loved one of theirs is not only not true, but cruel of
>> you to claim so. Even worse,
>>>> would be those who actually do believe you have heard from their
>> loved one, but take
>>> that
>>>> to mean they are not in 'Heaven' (as some believe those in
>> Heaven do not have the
>>> ability
>>>> to communicate here.) There's all kinds of beliefs which differ
>> from our reality that our
>>>> loved ones can be exactly where they are supposed to be, in a
>> good place, and still talk
>>> to
>>>> us via EVP. We have to make sure that there is a similarity in
>> world views.
>>>>
>>>> In regard to mediumship: Even as a experienced EVPer, and having
>> made connections
>>> with
>>>> my own loved ones, I still benefited from my sitting for an hour
>> with a medium. One of
>>>> the really neat things is, I brought my recorders and upon
>> playback, can actually hear
>>> EVP
>>>> that relates to what the medium is saying. So, as you wrote,
>> that was icing on the cake.
>>>> But the sitting alone, even without the EVP heard later,
>> provided an explanation for
>>> events
>>>> and a peace of mind to me about something I had carried with me
>> for 25yrs and had not
>>>> been able to resolve via EVP alone. The fee for that sitting was
>> some of the best money
>>>> I've ever spent in my life, as what I got from it was priceless.
>>>>
>>>> Personally, I'd like to see some joint studies done with mediums
>> and EVP, each modality
>>>> helping to validate the other in the process. :-)
>>>>
>>>> Margaret
>>>>

>>>>> advanced intuitive abilities should use it as a gift to help

>> and I

>> don't.
>>>>> Ron says he uses the best parts available and that the cost of

>>>>>>

>> would have
>>>>> the nerve to ask
>>>>>> for help from strangers? As Bruce recently shared, he gives
>> people
>>>>> invitations to contact
>>>>>> him privately in case they are too shy just ask a question
>>>>> publicly. Which means, by the
>>>>>> way, to some degree they have overcome some of that shyness
>> in
>>>>> order to post whatever it
>>>>>> was to begin with, which inspired him to make this offer.
>> What if
>>>>> they don't even have the

>>>>>>

>> out
>>>>> paranormal stuff, and run

>>>>>> Again, I ask people who are taking the position you and
>> Bruce are

>>>>>> you have this same harsh sentiment toward Ron Ricketts, who
>> makes
>>>>> and sells the
>>>>>> MiniBoxes? I realize he is passionate about this research
>> and
>>>>> helping others. Does that
>>>>>> give him amnesty for making a profit?
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Personally I think we need to not be so judgmental. At what
>> point
>>>>> does "profitable gain in
>>>>>> the paranormal field" become "sickening?" I have a friend
>> who is a
>>>>> medium. I mean THE
>>>>>> REAL DEAL. He charges for his services. The fee is
>> reasonable
>>>>> compared to many in his
>>>>>> field. Does he do this because he's a terrible person
>> looking to
>>>>> take advantage of people?
>>>>>> NO, he does so because he has been given a gift that changes
>>>>> people's lives for the better.
>>>>>> But he has to make a living.... has to support himself in
>> some way.
>>>>> And because he has
>>>>>> chosen to provide this service full time (and is not a trust
>> fund
>>>>> baby), he makes a profit.
>>>>>> This allows him to help far more people than he could if
>> working
>>>>> some other kind of job
>>>>>> and providing his services at no cost on the side.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I realize this is not exactly the same thing as gouging
>> people on
>>>>> the price for a
>>>>>> commercially available product, but making such blanket
>> statements
>>>>> about profitability in
>>>>>> the paranormal field being sickening is rather short-
>> sighted, in my
>>>>> opinion.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I have a southern friend who likes to say, "It's a mighty
>> thin
>>>>> plank that ain't got two sides."
>>>>>> I just don't think we have the right to claim that simply
>> because
>>>>> someone is offering a
>>>>>> good and or service for profit to consumers in the
>> paranormal
>>>>> market, that this
>>>>>> automatically means they are taking advantage of other's
>>>>> vulnerabilities.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> For Pete's sake, no one is twisting the people's arms to buy
>> those
>>>>> units on eBay. They are
>>>>>> perfectly free to buy from whatever source they choose.
>> Since the
>>>>> units do work as
>>>>>> claimed, we can argue that people have overpaid, shopped
>> unwisely,
>>>>> or whatever. I assure
>>>>>> you this happens every single day throughout the retail
>> market
>>>>> place with all types of
>>>>>> products and services.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> I will say I have a fairly heathy dose of distain for
>>>>> charlatans/scam artists (of any flavor in
>>>>>> any field) but that is not what we are talking about here.
>> We are
>>>>> talking about people who
>>>>>> are offering legitimate products to consumers. I'd rather
>> see
>>>>> people doing this for profit,
>>>>>> even when obscene, than running scams that damage people's
>>>>> physical, mental, and/or
>>>>>> financial well-being.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Margaret
>>>>>>

>> wrote:

>> strength
>>>>> in numbers, in this

>>>>>> and wants of others.

>>>>> do not let the size or

>>>>>> of him by higher entities.

>> And
>>>>> that at no time was this
>>>>>> equipment or knowledge there of
>>>>>>> to be for monetary gain.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> I adhere to this promise made by Frank to our friends on
>> the
>>>>> other side and feel that

>>>>>>> extortionists. . If a box is not attainable for a new
>> person yet,
>>>>> the right way. Then it

>>>>>>>

>> does
>>>>> not choose the box, the
>>>>>> box chooses the researcher"
